page.title: 17BOOTHBYS LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Boothby referred to as "Bodebi" in the first domesday book,originally got its name from the viking invaders who renamed the village with a -by ending to show it was a settlement.The name Pagnell was added later probaly originating from the Pagnell family who lived at the manor in Boothby.we spoke to the oldest man in Boothby, he told us Boothby was a farming village but now most people work in Grantham. The main water supply in Boothby used to be an underground stream. pumped by a man at the old clubhouse. A famous landmark in Boothby is a Norman Manor house,one of the oldest,best preserved manors in Britain,also in the village there is a 12th century church called ST Andrews it is in good codition and in 1896 some extentions were built on the side for a vestry.
